fields.summary: Ti API: Horizontal Layout Modes do not match.

fields.summary: Android: Default (horizontalWrap=true) horizontal layout centers children within rows

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
On iOS, Android, and Mobile Web, horizontal layout wraps its children into rows if it has more children than it can fit in the allotted width. There ends the similarity.

On iOS (and soon Mobile Web), the rows are positioned against the top of the view, and the 'top', 'bottom' values are interpreted _relative to the row's top and bottom_.

On Android, the top and bottom values are interpreted relative to the _view's top and bottom_, meaning that you can get children out of order, on top of each other, etc. Higgeldy-piggeldy. 

I contend that this serves no rational purpose and should be changed.
fields.summary: Android: Horizontal layout should provide consistent behavior when wrapping

comments.body: Closing ticket as duplicate with reference to the above comments.
